page.title: 01HUNSINGORE &SURROUNDING AREA
page.content: This area is in a rural part of{North {Yorkshire.}Most of the land is arable. The rest is mainly woodland and pasture,grazed by cattle and sheep. There is a very busy trunk road which runs in a North/South direction. It is called the{A.1.}and it is a dual carriageway.The river{Nidd}meanders through the South of the area on its way to join the {Ouse.}To the North a railway line runs in an East/West direction.It is a single track line which goes from Leeds to York.There is a local bus service which travels between York and Wetherby.Other bus services use the A.1.There are only 2 small villages where most of the people live,{Hunsingore }and{ {Walshford}.The others live on farms. The nearest town is {Wetherby},5 miles to the South.A footbridge across the{Nidd}joins{Hunsingore}to Cowthorpe
